text: A context-free grammar (CFG) consists of e a set of terminals ¥ e a set of non-terminals N e a start symbol SE N e a set P of production rules. Every production rule is of the form Y=2X...Xn where Y € N is a (single) non-terminal, and X; € (EUN)',0 < i < n can be a terminal or non-terminal. (Note that n can be 0 - meaning that the right-hand side of a rule can be €.)
